result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew D. Holm

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew D. Holm in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based on plea in 14CF389 State moves to dismiss but read in.  Court so dismisses and reads in case.

Defendant Matthew D. Holm in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is resolved with another case 14CF389.  Requesting argued sentencing date.  Attorney Martinez to get a date from Br. 1 to resolve both matters.  Bond continues.
Jury trial on April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew D. Holm in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez advises of waiver today.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.  State files information.
Preliminary hearing on February 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Matthew D. Holm in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Requests preliminary hearing.  Time limits continued waived.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
No poss. of controlled substances; Booking 12/17/14

Pre-trial conference on January 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Return date on January 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Matthew D. Holm in court with attorney Andrew I. Martinez.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $3000.00  Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No possession of controlled substance w/o valid prescription.  Booking by 12/17/14 @ 1 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
